medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was observed over a period of 6 months to be quieter, tired looking, and preoccupied. Initial symptoms included inability to concentrate, difficulty sleeping, and constipation. He reported feeling of depression, anxiety, poor concentration, fears related to masturbation, difficulty sleeping, weight loss, and hand tremor over a 12-month period leading up to hospital admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of treatment with electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) for depression. Glycosuria was noted during the first episode.
medical_history.family_history: Sister had recently been given ECT for depression.
medical_history.social_history: Unmarried, occupation as a bookkeeper. Not specified.
